page.title: 19Ecology
page.content: Lanes around Catthorpe were widened to take construction traffic,while the M1 was being built.With the loss of trees and hedges (many dating back to the enclosure of 1655/6) such animals as weasles, stouts,yellow hammers,and plants as violets and blackberries are no longer a common sight. Farmers in the area have a "love" of the land and try to replace any hedge or tree they need to fell.Although they burn their stubble,they are very careful not to create a nuisance, because of the M1. The River Avon is tested regularly by the Severn Trent Water Authority for any pollution,caused mainly by diesel and rubber being washed off the motorway by rain. Presently it is clean and full of fish.
